subject: Re: Query - Advise require re SEO and website pages

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia marked as Closed
Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Heath Maguire

full_threads.body:
Hi Heath
Yes please if you could code out the date and also add this into the menu.

Thank you so much

Kind regards
Trish
From: Heath Maguire - Wolf IQ <heath@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au>>
Sent: Sunday, July 12, 2020 10:44:15 AM
To: Petricia Augustus <paugustus@msra.org.au <mailto:paugustus@msra.org.au>>
Subject: Re: Query - Advise require re SEO and website pages

Hi Trish,

Yes we can code out the date just for this post. Let me know if you would like us to proceed?

Thanks and speak soon,
Heath Maguire
DIRECTOR

Phone: 1300 072 134 <tel:1300 072 134>
Mobile: 0415 162 271 <tel:0415 162 271>
Email: heath@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au>

<https://wpperk.com/?utm_source=Email&utm_medium=Signature&utm_campaign=WolfIQ> <https://wolfiq.com.au/?utm_source=Email&utm_medium=Signature&utm_campaign=WolfIQ>

> On 10 Jul 2020, at 3:12 pm, Petricia Augustus <paugustus@msra.org.au <mailto:paugustus@msra.org.au>> wrote:
>
> Thanks Heath.
>
> If possible I am keen to remove the visible date from that page as we will not be updating very much, if at all.
>
> Is there a way we can code into just this one news page to remove the date from being visible?
>
> Thanks
> Trish
>
> <image003.png>
> Petricia Augustus
> Head of Communications, Marketing and Operations
>
> MS Research Australia
> 02 8413 7910 • 1300 356 467
> paugustus@msra.org.au <mailto:paugustus@msra.org.au> • www.msra.org.au <http://www.msra.org.au/>
> Level 19 Northpoint • 100 Miller Street • North Sydney NSW 2060

> From: Heath Maguire - Wolf IQ <heath@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au>>
> Sent: Friday, 10 July 2020 3:09 PM
> To: Petricia Augustus <paugustus@msra.org.au <mailto:paugustus@msra.org.au>>
> Subject: Re: Query - Advise require re SEO and website pages
>
> Hi Trish,
>
> Sure, to answer your questions, here’s what I recommend:
>
> Keep it as a news item
> Add it the the dropdown menu under for people with MS
> The date needs to stay there and the same (SEO reasons). IF we can enhance/add to the information, and update the date to this/next week, that may encourage a further SEO boost. It shows Google that the information is so important that we are coming back and building on it. Is there some content we can add perhaps?
> URL will stay the same (this is important)
>
> Hope that answers your questions?
>
> Thanks and speak soon,
> Heath Maguire
> DIRECTOR
>
> Phone: 1300 072 134 <tel:1300%20072%20134>
> Mobile: 0415 162 271 <tel:0415%20162%20271>
> Email: heath@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au>
> <https://wpperk.com/?utm_source=Email&utm_medium=Signature&utm_campaign=WolfIQ>
> <https://wolfiq.com.au/?utm_source=Email&utm_medium=Signature&utm_campaign=WolfIQ>
>
>
> On 10 Jul 2020, at 8:50 am, Petricia Augustus <paugustus@msra.org.au <mailto:paugustus@msra.org.au>> wrote:
>
> Hi Heath
>
> Can I just confirm that you think the best course of action is to keep it as a news item but also add a link to the menu item “For People with MS” ??
>
> If we do this – can we somehow remove the date from the news item?? And will the URL change or are you just pointing the new menu item to the news page so the URL stays the same?
>
> Sorry for so many questions.
>
> Thanks
> Trish
>
>
>
> <image003.png>
> Petricia Augustus
> Head of Communications, Marketing and Operations
>

> From: Heath Maguire - Wolf IQ <heath@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au>>
> Sent: Thursday, 9 July 2020 7:56 PM
> To: Petricia Augustus <paugustus@msra.org.au <mailto:paugustus@msra.org.au>>
> Subject: Re: Query - Advise require re SEO and website pages
>
> Hi Trish,
>
> Great, idea, the easiest and safest thing to do would be to add it to the ‘For People with MS’ dropdown menu.
>
> For extra SEO brownie points you can also make sure you are linking to the post from other pages throughout the website (where it feels right). This will further emphasise to Google that the content on that post is important and in turn they should send more traffic there as well.
>
> The above suggestions will not have any negative SEO impacts on the article, they will only enhance it.
>
> Let me know if you need us to hook the article up to the main menu?
>
> Thanks and speak soon,
> Heath Maguire
> DIRECTOR
>
> Phone: 1300 072 134 <tel:1300%20072%20134>
> Mobile: 0415 162 271 <tel:0415%20162%20271>
> Email: heath@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au>
> <https://wpperk.com/?utm_source=Email&utm_medium=Signature&utm_campaign=WolfIQ>
> <https://wolfiq.com.au/?utm_source=Email&utm_medium=Signature&utm_campaign=WolfIQ>
>
>
>
> On 9 Jul 2020, at 5:24 pm, Petricia Augustus <paugustus@msra.org.au <mailto:paugustus@msra.org.au>> wrote:
>
> Hi Heath
>
> Wondering if you could please advise on the best course of action.
>
> We have been monitoring the website analytics and have identified one of our news pages https://msra.org.au/news/how-is-ms-diagnosed/ <https://msra.org.au/news/how-is-ms-diagnosed/> Is one of the top 5 pages visited consistently over a good number of months. As such we would like to consider making it available in a more easily accessible location i.e. in the For People with MS section.
>
> However my concerns are:
> By completely moving it or duplicating it we will lose the SEO which has been built up
> Not wanting to have duplicate content on the site.
>
> Can you please advise what options we have available to us so that we don’t destroy the fantastic SEO and search results that have been built up.
>
> I hope I have explained it ok but if not please feel free to give me a call on my mobile 0414 550 824 as I am still working from home.
>
> Thank you so much
>
> Kindest regards
> Trish
>
> <image002.png>
